title: MOOC Participation Motivation Analysis and Social Learning Strategy Design

context.prior_knowledge: Online learning experience and foundational digital literacy. Basic understanding of social learning environments and experience in online community activities
context.additional_context: Content design optimized for smartphone accessibility and microlearning formats. Emphasizes practical learning through project-based assessments. Requires designing activities that promote collaboration and social interaction among learners. Content development must consider alignment with educational curricula

learning_goals: Learners analyze MOOC participants' learning motivation factors (social interaction, self-directed goals, external certification acquisition) and explain them within a social context.
Learners compare the impact of gamification elements on learning immersion across cases of social relationship formation and civic engagement.

Learners apply three core principles (accessibility, interactivity, modularity) when designing mobile-optimized microlearning content, produce one video or infographic under five minutes, and achieve an "excellent" rating in two or more of three peer-assessment rubric criteria (clarity, engagement, mobile suitability). Additionally, they enhance collaborative learning experiences through peer feedback exchanges during content creation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
